Event.0: BC Assyrians record a solar eclipse that will be used to fix the chronology of Mesopotamian history
Event.1: Real estate mogul Donald Trump launches his campaign for US President
Event.2: Actress and model Elizabeth Hurley (45) divorces businessman Arun Nayar due to husband's unreasonable behavior
Event.3: After more than 30 years, American game show host Bob Barker stepped down as host of The Price Is Right.
Event.4: American singer Ella Fitzgerald—who was known for her enormous vocal range and inventive interpretations, in both ballads and jazz improvisations known as scat—died in Beverly Hills, California.
Event.5: Climactic eruption of the Mount Pinatubo volcano in the Philippines, the second-largest volcanic eruption on Earth of the 20th century
Event.6: Singer-songwriter Courtney Love (24) divorces vocalist James Moreland only 4 months after getting married
Event.7: US Open Men's Golf, Baltusrol GC: Jack Nicklaus sets new tournament scoring record 272 (-8) to win his 4th Open title, 2 strokes ahead of Isao Aoki of Japan
Event.8: US Senator Edward W. Brooke (58) divorces first wife Remigia Ferrari-Scacco after 31 years of marriage
Event.9:
Ice Cube
American rapper and actor
was born
Event.10: Bob Dylan records single "Like a Rolling Stone" (#1 in Rolling Stone magazine's "500 Greatest Songs of All Time")
Event.11:
Helen Hunt
American actress
was born
Event.12:
Xi Jinping
president of China
was born
Event.13:
Lakshmi Mittal
Indian businessman
was born
Event.14: During World War II, U.S. Marines attacked Saipan in the Mariana Islands.
Event.15: World War II: France surrenders to NAZI Germany, German troops occupy Paris
Event.16: "King Kong" actress Fay Wray (20) weds playwright-screenwriter John Monk Saunders (30)
Event.17:
Yury Andropov
president of Soviet Union
was born
Event.18: Princess Margaret of Connaught marries Gustav, Crown Prince of Sweden.
Event.19: Tsunami strikes Shinto festival on beach at Sanriku, Japan; 27,000 are killed, 9,000 injured and 13,000 houses destroyed
Event.20: World's first moving pictures caught on camera (used 12 cameras, each taking 1 picture) done to see if all 4 of a horse's hooves leave the ground
Event.21: Austrian contralto Ernestine Schumann-Heink, one of the principal interpreters of the operas of Richard Wagner and Richard Strauss before the outbreak of World War I, was born.
Event.22: The United States and Britain signed the Oregon Treaty, establishing the border between Canada and the United States at latitude 49° N.
Event.23: Charles Goodyear received a patent for the process of rubber vulcanization.
Event.24: First American flag seamstress Betsy Ross (25) weds mariner Joseph Ashburn
Event.25: George Washington was named commander in chief of the colonies by the Continental Congress.
Event.26: George Washington appointed commander-in-chief of the Continental Army, the day after Congress establishes the force
Event.27: The Battle of Kosovo, fought between the armies of the Serbian prince Lazar and the forces of the Ottoman sultan Murad I, concluded with an Ottoman victory.
Event.28: King John signs Magna Carta at Runnymede, near Windsor, England
Event.29:
Magna Carta sealed by King John
Magna Carta—a charter of English liberties that occupies a unique place in the popular imagination as a symbol and a battle cry against oppression—was sealed this day, under threat of civil war, by King John in 1215.
